generated_description:
Tovala is shaking up the meal delivery game with a unique combination of a smart oven and a subscription meal service. Founded in 2015 and hailing from Chicago, this food-tech startup is all about making cooking easier—think gourmet meals that practically cook themselves.

### What's The Deal?
Tovala pairs a smart oven with weekly deliveries of fresh, chef-crafted meals. The premise is simple: choose your meals, do a minute of prep, and let the oven take care of the rest. With a touch of a button (or a quick scan of a QR code), you can enjoy meals with no messy shopping or cleanup. The whole process typically takes under 25 minutes.

### Why It's Interesting
“Smart oven” might sound gimmicky, but Tovala has the vibe of a genuine innovation. The oven not only cooks but does so using chef-approved settings that make it easy to achieve restaurant-quality results. Each week, subscribers can choose from over 35 meals, making it easy to keep things fresh and exciting.

### Who’s Behind Tovala?
The company is part of Y Combinator's W16 batch and has grown to a team of 375 employees under the guidance of partners like Michael Seibel. Their approach to meal kits is about inclusivity, aiming to reduce the physical and mental burden of cooking.

### What's the Cost?
Tovala’s meals start at around $9.99 per serving, usually landing around $12.99 for most single serving options. The smart oven is offered at a hefty discount—as low as $69 with certain meal subscriptions, making it an accessible option for many.

### Customer Love
With over 31 million meals delivered, it’s clear that Tovala is resonating with its audience. Users rave about the quality and convenience—many likening it to having a personal chef.

### Final Thoughts
Tovala is not just a meal service; it’s a tech-savvy solution for those who want home-cooked meals without the hassle. If you’re tired of takeout but don’t want to spend hours in the kitchen, Tovala might just be the answer you're looking for. Check them out at [tovala.com](http://www.tovala.com) and see if it fits into your culinary routine.
